title: 2013 Horseshoe Canyon Ranch Winter Training Camp
BMC Training Camp
notes: Training camp only, BMC members only

title: Scott Tucker Scott Spring Classic
description: This event is a test of early season fitness. Limited to 10 teams of 5 participants, the event functions like a team time trial. All members of the teams must cross the finish line so the emphasis is on team work practice. Teams can be made up of all men, all women or mixed. Time bonuses will be awarded to mixed and all women teams and time penalties will be set based on composition of team.
course: The course is basically flat and straight but long. At 80 miles the teams will have to work together to complete. The course uses mainly country roads that are lightly traveled. There is a section of gravel that is about 8 miles in the course also.
registration: Teams can register via Facebook or on the day of the event.
notes: This is a team building exercise as well as a test for the early season in road racing. Although not a race in the traditional sense, there will be a payout at the end of the registration fees.
directions: Take interstate 440 to the Scott exit and go East to the venue

address.street: Cedar Glades Park - Wild Cat Rd

title: Two Rivers Time Trial Training Series
Cane Creek Timberland
description: The Cane Creek Timberland is Arkansasâ€™s newest mountain bike race, and this is its first year on the Arkansas Mountain Bike Championship Series. The park has over 18 miles of trails open to mountain bikes. The trail system features flowy downhills, short uphill climbs, and 52 bridges that make for a fast ride.
course: The course is 8 miles long on the park\'s trail system. It will be marked with pink arrows. The trails are permanently blazed with red, white, and yellow blazes.
registration: No Pre registration , On site Registration only. Registration opens at 7:00am and Closes 30 mins prior to send off of Category.  USA Cycling Annual or one day Licenses required.  One days can be purchased on site at an additional cost of $5.  This is an AMBCS race.  All Riders must hold an AMBCS number plate.  This plate is good for the entire 2013 Series.  Plates can be purchased onsite for $5.
notes: CAT 1 Pay Uses the Standard AMBCS pay out charts Available at www.AMBCS.com  Pay out for CAT 1 is 90% at 40% depth of field.
directions: From Little Rock: Head south on I-530 towards Pine Bluff. Take the last exit (Hwy 65/425) toward Lake Village/Monticello. Turn right outside Pine Bluff to follow Hwy 425. Head south into Star City. Go STRAIGHT through the light. Turn left onto Highway 293 (Cane Creek Rd.) Park is five miles east, on the left side of the road.

title: Tri County Shakedown
course: Long and winding with a lot of gravel
registration: Register on Facebook or in person
directions: We will email them to you once you register your team

title: One Eyed Dawg Dirt Time Trial
True Grit Ride 100
description: A ride to benefit the Community Services Clearinghouse. 10 mile Family Fun Ride plus 35, 50, 75 and 100 mile routes.
course: The ride begins and ends in Ben Geren Park in Fort Smith and continues through Charleston and Greenwood.
registration: Registration and more information at www.truegritride.com
notes: Enjoy a pasta dinner the night before, well stocked pit stops throughout the course, and a cookout at the finish line
directions: Ben Geren Park is located on Zero Street in Fort Smith, Arkansas due south of the airport.

title: Arkansas State Crit at Memorial Park
Hazel Valley Grand Prix
course: Course is 5000 ft elev gain in 50 miles of spectacular Ozark National Forest roads.
registration: Registration is event day only & starts @ 7am,
notes:
start time is 9am.

 
479-301-5268 for any questions.


participants without an annual USA Cycling mtb license will be required to pay $5 for event insurance.
directions: Hazel Valley Ranch, 16330 Olive rd Fayetteville

title: Gearhead Cyclocross
course: Approximately 1 mile 'Cross course on grass with barriers, hills, maybe some sand and singletrack.
registration: Online registration closes 10/11/2013 at midnight CDT.  Race day registration will be open from 8am to 9am SHARP.  Don't be late or you won't race!
directions: The race will be held at Craighead Forest Park, 4910 South Culberhouse Road in Jonesboro, AR. When you enter the park you will see signs directing you to the race site.

title: Hazel Valley 100
description: 100 mile gravel grinder with 2/3 of the ride at night.
course: 100 mile gravel grinder with 10,000 ft. of elevation gain.
directions: From Fayetteville take hwy 16 east to Durham, turn South on Hazel Valley road. Stay on Hazel valley rd. for 5 miles until it "T"s then turn left and go 100 yards to the Lodge.

title: Old Post CX presented by Carr's Chain Reaction
description: Old Post CX presented by Carr's Chain Reaction
course: Grass start and finish with wooden barriers, a asphalt climb, sand, and natural barriers.
registration: Registration is on site starting at 08:00am. $20 a race, $10 for each additional race. $10 one day USAC license if you dont have a USAC license.
notes: Trophies 3 deep in all Catagories. $400 added money.

title: BMC Cyclocross at Slaughter Pen Park
